intro: Rhombophyllum, commonly known as the rock fig or stone fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and consists of several species, most of which are succulent shrubs or small trees. The plants are characterized by their thick, fleshy leaves and showy, red or yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Rhombophyllum species are adapted to arid environments, making them popular among cactus and succulent enthusiasts. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
